Hospitalization Record.Chief Complaint: Severe bone pain and difficulty in walking for 3 days.

Present Illness.Onset: The symptoms started suddenly 3 days ago while at home, without any clear prodromal symptoms or identifiable triggers.
Present Illness.Main Symptoms: K. Ramos reports severe, throbbing pain localized in the left femur. The pain has been continuous, rated as an 8 out of 10 in severity, and is aggravated by walking or any weight-bearing activities. Local redness and swelling are also noted.
Present Illness.Accompanying Symptoms: Fever of 38.5°C (101.3°F) and general fatigue were observed, coinciding with the onset of bone pain.
Present Illness.Diagnosis and Treatment History: Patient visited her primary care physician two days ago, who ordered an X-ray and referred her to this hospital. Initial X-ray suggested bone inflammation but was inconclusive. No treatments were administered prior to admission.
Present Illness.General Condition Changes: Patient reports difficulty in sleeping due to pain, reduced appetite, and feeling generally weak. No significant changes in urination or defecation were noted. Weight is stable.

Past History.General Health Condition: Generally healthy with no major health issues previously.
Past History.Disease History: History of hypertension, managed with medication. No known history of diabetes or cancer.
Past History.Immunization History: Up to date on all recommended immunizations.
Past History.Surgery and Trauma History: Right knee replacement surgery 5 years ago. No history of significant trauma.
Past History.Allergy History: No known drug allergies. Allergic to shellfish.

Personal History.Living Habits: Lives alone, independent with ADLs. Non-smoker, drinks socially.
Personal History.Occupation and Working Conditions: Worked as a school teacher before retirement.
Personal History.Exposure History: No known exposure to industrial toxins, dust, or radioactive substances.

Marital History.Children's Condition: One daughter, healthy, living in Toronto.

Marital and Family History.Family History: Mother died of stroke at age 78. Father died of lung cancer at age 72. No siblings. No known family history of osteomyelitis.

Systematic Examination.Skin: Warm, red, and swollen over the left femur.
Systematic Examination.Chest: Thorax normal, lungs clear to auscultation, heart sounds normal, no murmurs.
Systematic Examination.Limbs: Swelling and tenderness over the left femur. Limited range of motion due to pain.
Systematic Examination.Nervous System: Alert and oriented, cranial nerves II-XII intact, muscle strength 5/5 except in the left leg where strength is 3/5 due to pain. Reflexes normal.

Hospitalization Record.Specialist Examination: Orthopedic consult advised for suspected osteomyelitis.
Hospitalization Record.Auxiliary Examination: X-ray on 25th October showed periosteal reaction. MRI recommended for further evaluation.
Hospitalization Record.Diagnostic Basis: Diagnosis based on patient's history of sudden severe bone pain, physical examination findings of localized redness and swelling over the femur, elevated temperature, and X-ray indicating periosteal reaction.
Hospitalization Record.Differential Diagnosis: Osteosarcoma ruled out due to limited periosteal reaction scope. Ewing's Sarcoma less likely due to irregular periosteal reaction. Osteitis Fibrosa Cystica ruled out due to absence of endocrine abnormalities. Osteoid Osteoma considered, but MRI pending confirmation.

Post-Admission Course Records.First Course Record: Admitted for further evaluation and management of suspected acute osteomyelitis. Plan includes blood cultures, MRI, intravenous antibiotics, and pain management. Differential diagnosis includes osteosarcoma, Ewing's Sarcoma, osteitis fibrosa cystica, and osteoid osteoma.
Post-Admission Course Records.Daily Course Records: Patient stable. Pain managed with IV analgesics. Fever persists, blood cultures pending.
Post-Admission Course Records.Senior Physician Rounds Records: Dr. L. Green examined patient. Confirmed initial management plan. Advised continuation of IV antibiotics until culture results.
Post-Admission Course Records.Handover Records: Discussed case with on-call physician. Patient stable, continue current treatment plan.
Post-Admission Course Records.Consultation Records: Orthopedic consult: MRI ordered, to rule out differential diagnoses and confirm osteomyelitis.

Medical Orders.Long-term Orders: IV antibiotics (Vancomycin 1g every 12 hours), Pain management (Morphine IV PRN), Regular vital signs monitoring, Blood cultures, MRI scan, Complete bed rest
Medical Orders.Temporary Orders: CBC, ESR, CRP levels, IV fluids as required

Hospitalization Record.Auxiliary Examination Reports: X-ray report: Periosteal reaction noted in left femur, suggestive of infection.
Hospitalization Record.Temperature Chart: 26th October: 38.5°C, Pulse 88bpm, Respiration 20 breaths/min, BP 130/80 mmHg

Diseases of the Musculoskeletal System a.Name: Acute Osteomyelitis
Diseases of the Musculoskeletal System a.Symptoms: Bone pain, difficulty in walking, local redness and swelling, etc.
Diseases of the Musculoskeletal System a.Differential Diagnosis: Osteosarcoma (bone destruction, periosteal reaction is relatively limited in scope), Ewing's Sarcoma (the periosteal reaction is regular compared to osteomyelitis, mostly in the form of onion-skin periosteal reaction), Osteitis Fibrosa Cystica, Osteoid Osteoma
